TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit OpenIdConnectOptions extends Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.RemoteAuthenticationOptions

Docs.summary: Configuration options for

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new
Docs.remarks:
Defaults:
AddNonceToRequest: true.
BackchannelTimeout: 1 minute.
ProtocolValidator: new .
RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound: true
ResponseType:
Scope: .
TokenValidationParameters: new with AuthenticationScheme = authenticationScheme.
UseTokenLifetime: false.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AdditionalAuthorizationParameters As IDictionary(Of String, String)

Docs.summary: Gets the additional parameters that will be included in the authorization request.
Docs.remarks: The additional parameters can be used to customize the authorization request, providing extra information or fulfilling specific requirements of the OpenIdConnect provider. These parameters are typically, but not always, appended to the query string.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the method used to redirect the user agent to the identity provider.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectConfiguration ^ Configuration { Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectConfiguration ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectConfiguration ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Configuration provided directly by the developer. If provided, then MetadataAddress and the Backchannel properties will not be used. This information should not be updated during request processing.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::IConfigurationManager<Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectConfiguration ^> ^ ConfigurationManager { Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::IConfigurationManager<Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectConfiguration ^> ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::IConfigurationManager<Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectConfiguration ^> ^ value); };
Public Property ConfigurationManager As IConfigurationManager(Of OpenIdConnectConfiguration)

Docs.summary: Responsible for retrieving, caching, and refreshing the configuration from metadata. If not provided, then one will be created using the MetadataAddress and Backchannel properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisableTelemetry { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.DisableTelemetry : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Indicates whether telemetry should be disabled. When this feature is enabled, the assembly version of the Microsoft IdentityModel packages is sent to the remote OpenID Connect provider as an authorization/logout request parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectEvents ^ Events { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectEvents ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectEvents ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the to notify when processing OpenIdConnect messages.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Boolean to set whether the handler should go to user info endpoint to retrieve additional claims or not after creating an identity from id_token received from token endpoint. The default is 'false'.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MapInboundClaims { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.MapInboundClaims : bool with get, set

Docs.summary:
Gets or sets the property on the default instance of in SecurityTokenValidator and default instance of in TokenHandler, which is used when determining whether or not to map claim types that are extracted when validating a .
If this is set to true, the Claim Type is set to the JSON claim 'name' after translating using this mapping. Otherwise, no mapping occurs.
The default value is true.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Nullable<TimeSpan> MaxAge { Nullable<TimeSpan> get(); void set(Nullable<TimeSpan> value); };
Public Property MaxAge As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.MaxAge : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the 'max_age'. If set the 'max_age' parameter will be sent with the authentication request. If the identity provider has not actively authenticated the user within the length of time specified, the user will be prompted to re-authenticate. By default no max_age is specified.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets if a metadata refresh should be attempted after a SecurityTokenSignatureKeyNotFoundException. This allows for automatic recovery in the event of a signature key rollover. This is enabled by default.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets if HTTPS is required for the metadata address or authority. The default is true. This should be disabled only in development environments.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::IdentityModel::Tokens::ISecurityTokenValidator ^ SecurityTokenValidator { Microsoft::IdentityModel::Tokens::ISecurityTokenValidator ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::IdentityModel::Tokens::ISecurityTokenValidator ^ value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("SecurityTokenValidator is no longer used by default. Use TokenHandler instead. To continue using SecurityTokenValidator, set UseSecurityTokenValidator to true. See https://aka.ms/aspnetcore8/security-token-changes")]

[<System.Obsolete("SecurityTokenValidator is no longer used by default. Use TokenHandler instead. To continue using SecurityTokenValidator, set UseSecurityTokenValidator to true. See https://aka.ms/aspnetcore8/security-token-changes")>]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the used to validate identity tokens.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString SignedOutCallbackPath { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString value); };
member this.SignedOutCallbackPath : Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.PathString with get, set

Docs.summary: The request path within the application's base path where the user agent will be returned after sign out from the identity provider. See post_logout_redirect_uri from http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-session-1_0.html#RedirectionAfterLogout.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SignedOutRedirectUri { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SignedOutRedirectUri : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The uri where the user agent will be redirected to after application is signed out from the identity provider. The redirect will happen after the SignedOutCallbackPath is invoked.
Docs.remarks: This URI can be out of the application's domain. By default it points to the root.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SignOutScheme { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SignOutScheme : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The Authentication Scheme to use with SignOut on the SignOutPath. SignInScheme will be used if this is not set.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SkipUnrecognizedRequests { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.SkipUnrecognizedRequests : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Indicates if requests to the CallbackPath may also be for other components. If enabled the handler will pass requests through that do not contain OpenIdConnect authentication responses. Disabling this and setting the CallbackPath to a dedicated endpoint may provide better error handling. This is disabled by default.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UsePkce { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UsePkce : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Enables or disables the use of the Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE) standard. This only applies when the is set to . See . The default value is `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.UseSecurityTokenValidator : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether to use the or the for validating identity tokens.
Docs.remarks:
The advantages of using TokenHandler are:
There is an Async model.
The default token handler is a which is faster than a .
There is an ability to make use of a Last-Known-Good model for metadata that protects applications when metadata is published with errors. SecurityTokenValidator can be used when needs a . When using TokenHandler, will be a .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UseTokenLifetime { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UseTokenLifetime : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Indicates that the authentication session lifetime (e.g. cookies) should match that of the authentication token. If the token does not provide lifetime information then normal session lifetimes will be used. This is disabled by default.
